Specimen Type: Nasopharyngeal swabs, throat swabs, sputum, or other respiratory specimens
Purpose: To detect Mycoplasma pneumoniae DNA in clinical respiratory specimens using PCR for accurate diagnosis of infection.
Container: Sterile respiratory swab or leak-proof container appropriate for respiratory specimens
Equipment: PCR thermal cycler, Class II biosafety cabinet, microcentrifuge, vortex mixer, spectrophotometer (optional)
